alert.note: Alert for East Platte County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 2:54PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Sioux, southeastern Niobrara, Goshen and east central Platte Counties through 330 PM MDT... At 253 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Prairie Center to 6 miles south of Jay Em to near Fort Laramie National Historic Site to 7 miles northeast of Lakeview North. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Torrington, Guernsey, Lingle, Fort Laramie, Yoder, Agate Bed National Monument, Prairie Center, Jay Em, Fort Laramie National Historic Site, Grayrocks Reservoir, Veteran, Chugcreek, Slater and Hwy 85 At Dry Rawhide Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne.
